alert.note: Alert for Saipan (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 9:03PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CHST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Marianas, including the following counties, Kalabera, I Naftan, I Maddok, Talafofo, As Falipe, Kagman III, As Mahetog, As Akina, Tottotville, Forbidden Island, As Palacios, Chalan Kanoa III, As Terlaje, China Town, Sadog Tasi, Hilaihai, San Jose (Oleai), As Rabagau, Tapochao, Kannat Tabla, As Perdido, Achugao, Navy Hill, San Antonio, Fananganan, Chalan Kanoa IV, Chacha, As Matuis, San Roque, Matansa, Tangke, Kagman II, Nanasu, Kagman I, Kagman IV, Pidos Kahalo, I Pitot, Sabaneta, Banaderu, I Denni, Fanonchuluyan, Marpi, As Teo, Capitol Hill, Puerto Rico, Maturana Hill, American Memorial Park, Chalan Galaide, Agingan, Koblerville, Afetnas, Chalan Piao, Chalan Kanoa II, Chalan Kanoa I, Kagman, Dagu, I Fadang, Dandan, I Akgak, Garapan, San Vicente, Laulau Bay, As Gonna, Papago, Opyan, Gualo Rai, Chalan Laulau, Finasisu, Chalan Kiya, Susupe, As Lito and Chalan Rueda. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 903 PM ChST, The public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between one half and three quarters of an inch of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of half an inch to one inch inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Garapan, Dandan, China Town, As Mahetog, Koblerville, Chalan Kanoa I, San Antonio, Chalan Kanoa II, Chalan Kanoa III, San Roque, Kagman, Chalan Kanoa IV, Kagman III, Gualo Rai, Afetnas, Chalan Piao, Fananganan, Chalan Laulau, Chalan Kiya and San Jose (Oleai). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
